Summary I am a PhD candidate in anthropology at Stanford. My work focuses on the emergence of the Angolan middle class after decades of conflict, and I recently conducted nearly two years of ethnographic fieldwork in Angola, and also in Brazil where many young Angolans go to study.  
Before coming to Stanford, I completed an MSc in Forced Migration at Oxford, and an undergraduate degree in social sciences at the University of Cape Town, in my home country, South Africa. I could have remained at Oxford for the PhD, but wanted to be at the edge of new knowledge, and Silicon Valley was therefore much more attractive. I have particular interests in ontology, power and inequality, and narrative and imagination. 
I believe anthropological perspectives are enormously enriching to many fields, from social justice to corporate practice, and look forward to a career that in some way allows me to bridge out of the academy with these insights, whilst maintaining analytic rigor, disciplined curiosity, and empathy.
